info.title: Sage Accounting API - Banking
info.description: Documentation of the Sage Business Cloud Accounting API.

contact.name: Sage Business Cloud Accounting API Team

tags.name: Bank Accounts
tags.description:
Bank Accounts are a reflection of real-life bank accounts for the associated business. They are used to manage most transactional activity in Sage Business Cloud Accounting as well as track balances. The bank_account_type_id is a required attribute which can only be updated while the bank account has no associated activity. The API allows you to create, delete, update and show bank accounts.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Banking

tags.name: Bank Account Types
tags.description:
The bank account type is unique to a particular bank account and dictates the different kinds of transactions that can be recorded against the Bank Account itself.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Banking

tags.name: Bank Deposits
tags.description: Bank Deposits, unlike bank transfers can only be used to move funds from bank accounts with bank account type CASH_IN_HAND. However the destination account can be of any type. The API allows you to show, create and delete bank deposits.

tags.name: Bank Reconciliations
tags.description: Bank Reconciliations are mainly used in the front end of the application to ensure that the business bank accounts match any real-life transactions and statements. The API allows show, create and update however only certain parameters are valid for POST requests.

tags.name: Bank Transfers
tags.description: Like Bank Deposits, Bank Transfers are used to move funds from one bank account to another. The origin can be of any bank account type other than CASH_IN_HAND and destination bank account can be of any bank account type. The API allows you to show, create, update and delete bank transfers.

get.description:
### Endpoint Availability

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª
* Accounting Standard: ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

### Access Control Restrictions

Requires the authenticated user to have any of the following roles in the area `Bank`: Full Access, Read Only, Restricted Access

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Bank Accounts changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: deleted_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Bank Accounts deleted since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Not inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: nested_attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for nested entities of the Bank Accounts (expose all nested attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: exclude_stripe
parameters.description: Use this to filter out Stripe Bank Accounts

parameters.name: filter_inactive_bank_accounts
parameters.description: Use this to filter inactive bank accounts

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: The App Name

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Bank Accounts per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Bank Accounts

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Bank Accounts (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: deleted_since

parameters.description: Use this to filter by Deposits dates

parameters.description: Returns the given number of Deposits per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Deposits

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Deposits (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Order by a given attribute (required) and direction (optional; `asc` or `desc`; defaults to `asc`).
Available attributes are:
created_at, updated_at, date

Example: `sort=created_at` or `sort=created_at:desc`

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

bank_account_details.description: The account details for the bank account

ledger_account.description: The ledger account for the bank account

bank_account_type.description: The bank account type for the bank account

main_address.description: The main address for the bank account

main_contact_person.description: The main contact for the bank account

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the bank account

editable.description: Indicates whether or not the bank account can be edited

deletable.description: Indicates whether or not the bank account can be deleted

journal_code.description: The journal code of the bank account (France only)

default_payment_method.description: The default payment method of the bank account

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the bank ledger account'

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

is_active.description: Indicates whether the Bank account is active or inactive.

currency.description: The currency for the bank account

Base.description:
### Endpoint Availability

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

bank_account.description: The related bank account of the address, if the address belongs to a bank account.

contact.description: The related contact of the address, if the address belongs to a contact.

address_type.description:
Defines the nature of the address (Shipping, Billing, Head Office etc.).
Start defaults to "Sales" for Customers and "Purchasing" for Vendors

name.description: The custom name of the address

country_group.description:
Country group allows countries to be filtered for selection.
Set it to e.g. EU if the address is within the EEC.

is_main_address.description: Specifies the address as the contact's main address. Only a single address can exist for a contact in Start so this is always true when returned by the API but cannot be seen in the UI

job_title.description: The job title of the contact

fax.description: The fax number of the contact

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

name.description: The name of the journal code

code.description: The code of the journal code

journal_code_type.description: The journal code type of the journal code

control_name.description:
The control name of the journal code

Control names are identifiers for a journal codes with a specific meaning. Some examples are `AC` for
purchases, `VE` for sales, `OD` for other transactions and `REPBAL` for opening balances.

reserved.description:
Indicates whether the journal code is reserved.

Reserved journal codes cannot be deleted. A journal code is reserved when it has a control name.
Please note that journal codes can also not be deleted when there is any journal that is using
the code.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

bank_account_type_id.description: The bank account type for the bank account

ledger_account_id.description: The ID of the Ledger Account.

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the bank account

default_payment_method_id.description: The ID of the Default Payment Method.

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the bank ledger account'

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

Control names are identifiers for a journal codes with a specific meaning. Some examples are `AC` for
purchases, `VE` for sales, `OD` for other transactions and `REPBAL` for opening balances.

reserved.description:
Indicates whether the journal code is reserved.

Reserved journal codes cannot be deleted. A journal code is reserved when it has a control name.
Please note that journal codes can also not be deleted when there is any journal that is using
the code.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

transaction_type.description: The transaction type of the item

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

from_bank_account.description: From bank account - money leaves this account

to_bank_account.description: To bank account - money goes into this account

date.description: User generated date of transaction, not necessarily when it was created

total_amount.description: Total of cash and cheques in the deposit
